title: Apple, MLB partner to bring Friday-night games to Apple TV+
text:
The new offering will be available for a limited time without the need for a subscription.

In addition to “Friday Night Baseball,” viewers in the U.S. will have access to “MLB Big Inning,” a live show featuring highlights and look-ins airing every weeknight during the regular season. Viewers in the U.S. and Canada also will have access to a new 24/7 livestream.

The first two series of the Major League Baseball regular season have been canceled after owners and locked-out players failed to agree on a new labor contract ahead of a management-imposed deadline. Opening day had been scheduled for March 31.

“With national availability and international reach, MLB on Apple TV+ offers an exciting new platform to fans that allows a wider audience to connect with the game,” MLB Revenue Officer Noah Garden said in prepared remarks.
